did.unittitle: Facsimiles of the Declaration of Independence signatures
did.abstract: Embroidered silk facsimile of the signatures of all signers of the Declaration of Independence, created circa 1850. An inscription states that signatures were "taken from Irvings History of the U.S. which John Quincy Adams certified were exact imitations of the original." Included are the signatures of the four signers from New York State, including William Floyd and Francis Lewis of Long Island, Philip Livingston of Brooklyn, and Lewis Morris of Westchester.
